original: Daṇḍikathā
analyzed: daṇḍi kathā
translated: The story of the staff-bearer

original: kasmiṃścid deśe daṇḍītyabhihito brāhmaṇaḥ🔽kaścit prativasati sma /
analyzed: kasmiṃścid deśe daṇḍī iti abhihitaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ  kaścid prativasati sma
translated: In a certain place, a Brahmin named Dandin was living.

original: sa nitarāṃ dīno'śanena hīno babhūva /
analyzed: sa nitarām dīna uśanena hīnaḥ babhūva
translated: He was extremely poor and lacked food.

original: sa ca vasanair api hīno babhūva /🔽tena kasmāccid gṛhapatervṛṣaḥ
analyzed: sa ca vasanaiḥ api hīnaḥ babhūva  tena kasmāccid gṛhapateḥ vṛṣaḥ
translated: He was also lacking in clothing.

original: kaścid dhāritaḥ /
analyzed: kaścid dhāritaḥ
translated: He was keeping a bull for a certain householder.

original: divābhāge sa vṛṣabhaṃ karmaṇi niyojya paścāt tamādāya ca
analyzed: divābhāge sa vṛṣabham karmaṇi niyojya paścāt tam ādāya ca
translated: In the daytime, having employed the bull in work, he took it to the back

original: tasya gṛhapatergṛhaṃ jagāma /
analyzed: tasya gṛhapateḥ gṛham jagāma
translated: and went to the house of that householder.

original: tatra gṛhe gṛhapatirhi bhojyaṃ bubhuje /
analyzed: tatra gṛhe gṛhapatiḥ hi bhojyam bubhuje
translated: There, in the house, the householder ate food.

original: daṇḍinā sa ca vṛṣo
analyzed: daṇḍinā sa ca vṛṣo
translated: The bull was left by Dandin

original: bhavanasya ajira madhye tyaktaḥ /
analyzed: bhavanasya ajira madhye tyaktaḥ
translated: in the middle of the courtyard of the house.

original: ṛṣabho dvārāntaraṃ krāntvā naṣṭo
analyzed: ṛṣabhaḥ dvāra antaram krāntvā naṣṭaḥ
translated: The bull entered the door and disappeared.

original: babhūva / sa gṛhapatirapi bhuktvā tad bhojyamuttasthau /
analyzed: babhūva sa gṛhapatiḥ api bhuktvā tat bhojyam uttasthau
translated: The householder also ate the food and got up.

original: tatra gṛhacatvare ca vṛṣaṃ nāvalokya tena gṛhapatinā vṛṣabhaḥ kkāstī ti daṇḍī papracche /
analyzed: tatra gṛha catvare ca vṛṣam na avalokya tena gṛhapatinā   vṛṣabhaḥ kka asti iti daṇḍī papracche
translated: There, not seeing the bull in the courtyard of the house, the householder asked Dandin, Where is the bull?

original: tena daṇḍinā praty uktam tava gṛhe muktaḥ iti /
analyzed: tena daṇḍinā prati uktam tava gṛhe muktaḥ iti
translated: That Dandin replied, It was released in your house.

original: gṛhapatiḥ punar uvāca tvayā me puṃgavo yatastyaktaḥ atastaṃ tvaṃ me pratyarpaye ti /
analyzed: gṛhapatiḥ punar uvāca   tvayā me puṃgavaḥ yatas tyaktaḥ atas tam tvam me pratyarpaye ti
translated: The householder said again, Since you released my bull, you must return it to me.

original: tena daṇḍinā uttaritam na mayā vṛṣo nāśitaḥ iti /
analyzed: tena daṇḍinā uttaritam   na mayā vṛṣaḥ nāśitaḥ iti
translated: The man with the stick replied, I did not kill the bull.

original: tatastau sahitau rājñaḥ sakāśaṃ gacchāva /
analyzed: tatas tau sahitau rājñaḥ sakāśam gacchāva
translated: Then they both went to the king.

original: sa rājā āvayornyāyyatvam anyāyyatvaṃ ca vicārayiṣyatī tyuktvā jāmatuśca /
analyzed: sa rājā āvayoḥ nyāyya tvam anyāyya tvam ca vicārayiṣyatī iti uktvā jāmatuḥ ca
translated: The king will decide who is right and who is wrong between us.

original: tadā kasyacij janāntarasya kāścidaśvā chinnabandhanā sartā palāyitavatī /
analyzed: tadā kasyacid jana antarasya kāścid aśvā chinna bandhanā sartā palāyitavatī
translated: At that time, some horses of a certain person, having their bonds broken, ran away.

original: tena janāntareṇa daṇḍī kka mamāśve ti pṛṣṭaḥ /
analyzed: tena jana antareṇa daṇḍī kka mama aśve  ti  pṛṣṭaḥ
translated: The person asked the man with the stick, Where are my horses?

original: daṇḍī pratya uvāca na mayā vṛṣavat turṅgamā 'pi bandhanān nocite ti /🔽tatas tena daṇḍinā aśvāgatirodhārtha upalaḥ kaścij jagṛhe aśvāṃ prati nicikṣipe ca /
analyzed: daṇḍī pratya uvāca   na mayā vṛṣa vat turṅgamā pi bandhanāt na ucitā  tatas tena daṇḍinā aśva āgati rodha arthaiḥ upalaḥ kaścid jagṛhe aśvām prati nicikṣipe ca
translated: The man with the stick replied, Like the bull, the horses were not released by me from their bonds.🔽Then the man with the stick took a stone to block the path of the horses and threw it at the horses.

original: sa copalaḥ aśvāyāḥ padamekamāhatya tad babhañja /
analyzed: sa ca upalaḥ aśvāyāḥ padam ekam āhatya tat babhañja
translated: That stone struck one of the horse's hooves and broke it.

original: tena janena jagade yatastvayā turagā mama māritā'taḥ pratidehi me mamā'śvām iti /
analyzed: tena janena jagade   yatas tvayā turagāḥ mama māritāḥ atas pratidehi me mama aśvām
translated: The man said, Since you have killed my horses, give me back my horse.

original: daṇḍinoktam kasya hetoraśvāṃ dāsyāmi / iti /🔽janena tenā''kāritam ihāgaccha /
analyzed: daṇḍinā uktam     kasya hetoḥ aśvām dāsyāmi   iti  janena tena akāritam    iha āgaccha
translated: The man with the stick said, For what reason should I give you the horses?🔽The man requested, Come here.

original: nṛpasya savidhe ca vrajāva /
analyzed: nṛpasya savidhe ca vrajāva
translated: And let us go in the presence of the king.

original: sa āvayorvicāraniṣpattiṃ kariṣyatī ti /
analyzed: saḥ āvayoḥ vicāra niṣpattim kariṣyati iti
translated: He will decide our dispute.”

original: tadā tau jagmatuśca /🔽tato vairibhayāt sa daṇḍī palāyitumārebhe /
analyzed: tadā tau jagmatuḥ ca  tatas vairi bhayāt sa daṇḍī palāyitum ārebhe
translated: Then they went to the king.🔽At that time, the man with the staff, out of fear of his enemy, began to flee.

original: apasaraṇāvasare sa ca kasyacit kuḍayasyādhastād avapupluve /
analyzed: apasaraṇa avasare sa ca kasyacid kuḍayasya adhastāt avapupluve
translated: At the time of escape, he jumped under a wall.

original: tasya puratastantuvāyaḥ kaścit tantūn saṃvāyāsīnaḥ /🔽tasya kuvindasya upariṣṭāt daṇḍī papāta /🔽sa ca tantuvāyaḥ kālagataḥ /
analyzed: tasya puratas tantuvāyaḥ kaścid tantūn saṃvāya āsīnaḥ  tasya kuvindasya upariṣṭāt daṇḍī papāta  sa ca tantuvāyaḥ kālagataḥ
translated: In front of him, a certain weaver was weaving threads.🔽The man with the staff fell on top of that weaver.🔽And that weaver died.

original: tatas tantuvāyasya bhāryayā sa daṇḍī kare dadhre /
analyzed: tatas tantuvāyasya bhāryayā sa daṇḍī kare dadhre
translated: Then the weaver's wife grabbed the man with the staff by the hand.

original: sā uvāca yatastvayā mama bhartā nihataḥ ataḥ pratiyaccha me bhartāram iti /
analyzed: sā uvāca   yatas tvayā mama bhartā nihataḥ atas pratiyaccha me bhartāram iti
translated: She said, Since you killed my husband, give me back my husband.

original: daṇḍī praty uvāca kathaṃ te svāmī mayā pratidāyiṣyate / iti /
analyzed: daṇḍī prati uvāca   katham te svāmī mayā iti
translated: The man with the staff replied, How can I give back your husband to you?

original: sovāca ita ehi /
analyzed: sā uvāca itas ehi
translated: She said, Come, let's go.

original: rājñaḥ sannidhiṃ gacchāva /
analyzed: rājñaḥ sannidhim gacchāva
translated: Let's go to the king.

original: tenāvayorvicāro niṣpādayiṣyata iti / tatastau jagmatuḥ /
analyzed: tena āvayoḥ vicāraḥ niṣpādayiṣyate iti tatas tau jagmatuḥ
translated: He will decide our dispute. Then they went.

original: teṣāṃ gamana mārgasya madhye kācid gambhīrā nadī babhūva /
analyzed: teṣām gamana mārgasya madhye kācid gambhīrā nadī babhūva
translated: In the middle of their path, there was a deep river.

original: salilasya tasya sammukha taṭe sūtradharaḥ kaścin mukhena kuṭhāramudrahannāgataḥ🔽papracche sa ca daṇḍinā kiyaj jalasya gāmbhīryam iti /
analyzed: salilasya tasya sammukha taṭe sūtradharaḥ kaścid mukhena kuṭhāra mudra han āgataḥ  papracche sa ca daṇḍinā    kiyat jalasya gāmbhīryam iti
translated: On the opposite bank of that water, a certain carpenter came with an axe in his mouth.🔽He asked the staff-bearer, How deep is the water?

original: gabhīratā'sti nīrasye ti kathanena sūtradharasya kuṭhāro jale papāta /
analyzed: gabhīra tā asti nīrasya iti kathanena sūtradharasya kuṭhāraḥ jale papāta
translated: When he said, The water is deep, the carpenter's axe fell into the water.

original: takṣā paraśuṃ ca na prāpa /🔽tena takṣaṇā daṇḍī haste kagṛhe /
analyzed: takṣā paraśum ca na prāpa  tena takṣaṇā daṇḍī haste
translated: The carpenter did not get his axe.🔽The staff-bearer took it in his hand.

original: sūtradhareṇādhiṃkṣipto tvayā me paraśvadhaḥ payasi pātitaḥ iti /
analyzed: tvayā me paraśvadhaḥ payasi pātitaḥ
translated: The carpenter accused him, You dropped my axe into the water.

original: tena daṇḍinā praty ūce na mayā'yam astaḥ iti /
analyzed: tena daṇḍinā prati   ūce   na mayā ayam astaḥ iti
translated: The staff-bearer replied, I did not drop it.

original: ihā''yāhi /
analyzed: iha āyāhi
translated: Come here.

original: nṛpateḥ sakāśaṃ ca prasarāva /🔽tenā''vayornirṇayo
analyzed: nṛpateḥ sakāśam ca prasarāva  tena āvayoḥ nirṇayaḥ
translated: And let us go before the king.🔽He will decide between us.

original: vidhāsyata iti vadiṃsvā tau jagmatuḥ /🔽tatas te sarve gatvā ca narapateḥ sannidhiṃ prāpuḥ /
analyzed: vidhāsyate iti vadiṃsvā tau jagmatuḥ  tatas te sarve gatvā ca narapateḥ sannidhim prāpuḥ
translated: Saying this, they went.🔽Then they all went and reached the presence of the king.

original: te bhūbhṛtaścaraṇe🔽śiṃrasā praṇemuḥ /
analyzed: te bhūbhṛtaḥ caraṇe  śiṃrasā praṇemuḥ
translated: And the king🔽bowed at the feet of the king.

original: ekapārśve ca niṣeduḥ /🔽tataśca bhūpatiṃnā te papracchire kiṃmarthaṃ yūyamāgatāḥ iti /
analyzed: eka pārśve ca niṣeduḥ  tatas ca te papracchire   kiṃmartham yūyam āgatāḥ iti
translated: And they sat down to one side.🔽Then the king asked them, Why have you come?

original: tadā taiḥ sarvairdaṇḍigṛhapatyorvivādo rājñe vivṛtaḥ /
analyzed: tadā taiḥ sarvaiḥ daṇḍi gṛhapatyoḥ vivādaḥ rājñe vivṛtaḥ
translated: Then all of them told the king about the dispute between the staff-bearer and the householder.

original: tad vivaraṇamākarṇya bhūpena daṇḍī babhāṣe kiṃ tvayā vṛṣo dhārita / itiṃ /
analyzed: tat vivaraṇam ākarṇya bhūpena daṇḍī babhāṣe    kim tvayā vṛṣaḥ dhāritaḥ
translated: Having heard that explanation, the king said to the staff-bearer, Did you hold the bull?

original: daṇḍī giramādade atha kiṃm iti /
analyzed: daṇḍī giram ādade    atha kim iti
translated: The staff-bearer spoke, What is it?

original: rājovāca yāvat pratiyaccha vṛṣabham /
analyzed: rājā uvāca    yāvat pratiyaccha vṛṣabham
translated: The king said, As long as you give back the bull.

original: tathā pratidehi yathā gṛhapatinā puṃgavaḥ pratyarṇaṇakāle dṛśyate iti /🔽daṇḍayuvāca sasambodhanaṃ hi na vṛṣo gṛhapataye prati dattaḥ iti /
analyzed: tathā pratidehi yathā gṛhapatinā puṃgavaḥ pratyarṇaṇa kāle dṛśyate   / daṇḍayuḥ uvāca    sa sambodhanam hi na vṛṣaḥ gṛhapataye prati   dattaḥ   iti
translated: And give it back in such a way that the householder will see the bull again at the time of plowing.🔽The staff-bearer said, The bull was not given back to the householder with an address.

original: narādhipenoddhoṣitam yato'munā daṇḍinā''bhāṣaṇamantareṇa vṛṣabhaḥ
analyzed: narādhipena uddhā uṣitam yatas amunā daṇḍinā ābhāṣaṇam antareṇa vṛṣabhaḥ
translated: The king proclaimed, Since this staff-bearer gave back the bull without speaking,

original: pratidade ato'sya rasanāṃ chindhi /
analyzed: pratidade atas asya rasanām chindhi
translated: cut out his tongue.

original: yato hi gṛhasvāmī vṛṣamāgacchantaṃ
analyzed: yatas hi gṛha svāmī vṛṣam āgacchantam
translated: Since the householder,

original: paśyannapiṃ na babandha ato'sya nayanam ekam utpāṭaye ti /
analyzed: paśyan apim na babandha atas asya nayanam ekam utpāṭaye ti
translated: though seeing the bull coming, did not bind it, cut out one of his eyes.

original: gṛhapatiṃnoce prathamato mama vṛṣo daṇḍinā nāśitaḥ /
analyzed: gṛhapatim na ūce prathamatas mama vṛṣaḥ daṇḍinā nāśitaḥ
translated: The householder said, First, my bull was destroyed by the staff-bearer.

original: dvitīyato mama nayanāpanayanaṃ yato varamato vivāde daṇḍyeva jayī bhavatu iti /
analyzed: dvitīyatas mama nayana apanayanam yatas varam atas vivāde daṇḍī eva jayī bhavatu  / iti
translated: Second, my eye was removed. Therefore, in this dispute, let the staff-bearer be the winner.

original: janena kenacit turaṅgamākhāminā ūce deva daṇḍinā mamāśvā mārite ti /
analyzed: janena kenacid  ūce   deva daṇḍinā mama aśvāḥ mārite
translated: Someone said, O king, my horse was killed by the staff-bearer.

original: nṛpeṇa daṇḍī papracche kathaṃ tvayāśvā nihate ti /
analyzed: nṛpeṇa daṇḍī papracche   katham tvayā aśvāḥ nihate
translated: The king asked Danda, How did you kill the horse?

original: daṇḍī cacakṣe yadāhaṃ pathā gantumārabdhavāṃstadā turaṅgamā sanāgatā /
analyzed: daṇḍī cacakṣe    yadā aham pathā gantum ārabdhavān tadā turaṅgamā
translated: Danda said, When I started going on the path, the horse came.

original: janenā'nenā'śvā bandhanān na mociteti sā svayamucchinnabandhanā tadā prāptā /
analyzed: janena anena aśvā bandhanāt na mocitā iti sā svayam ucchinna bandhanā tadā prāptā
translated: The people did not release the horse from the bonds, so it came itself, breaking the bonds.

original: tasyā javanirodhārthaṃ mayā'śmā kaścidāttaḥ /
analyzed: tasyāḥ java nirodha artham mayā aśmā kaścid āttaḥ
translated: To stop its speed, I took up a stone.

original: grāvāṇaṃ taṃ niratyāśvā sā mayā nihatā iti /
analyzed: grāvāṇam tam niratyāśvā sā mayā nihatā iti
translated: With that stone, I killed the horse.

original: narapatinoce aśvapatinā'śvā bandhanān na mociteti hetorasya rasanāṃ chindhi /
analyzed: narapatinā ūce   aśvapatinā aśvā bandhanāt na mocitā iti hetoḥ asya rasanām chindhi
translated: The king said, Since the horse was not released from the bonds by the horse-keeper, cut off his tongue.

original: daṇḍinopalo
analyzed: daṇḍinā upalaḥ
translated: Danda threw the stone.

original: nicikṣipa iti bāhum asyaikaṃ kṛndhi iti /
analyzed: nicikṣipe iti bāhum asya ekam kṛndhi iti
translated: Cut off his one arm.

original: janena tena saptipatinā proktam prathamato mama ghoṭakī hatā /
analyzed: janena tena sapti patinā proktam   prathamatas mama ghoṭakī hatā
translated: The man said, First my mare was killed.

original: dvitīyato yato
analyzed: dvitīyatas yatas
translated: Second,

original: jiṃhvā me chetsyate varamato daṇḍayeva jayī bhavatu iti /
analyzed: jiṃhvāḥ me chetsyate varam atas daṇḍaya iva jayī bhavatu  / iti
translated: since my tongue will be cut off, it is better to punish me. Let the victor be victorious.

original: tatas tantuvāyasya bhāryayā babhāṣe bhartā me daṇḍinā hataḥ iti /
analyzed: tatas tantuvāyasya bhāryayā babhāṣe    bhartā me daṇḍinā hataḥ iti
translated: Then the weaver's wife said, My husband was killed by Danda.

original: daṇḍinā nṛpāya niveditam vardhitā mama śatrava iti bhītaḥ sannahaṃ prācīrādavaplutya palāyitavān /
analyzed: daṇḍinā nṛpāya niveditam   vardhitāḥ mama śatravaḥ iti bhītaḥ san aham prācīrāt avaplutya palāyitavān
translated: The stick-bearer reported to the king, My enemies have increased, and being afraid, I jumped over the rampart and fled.

original: tena ca antarāle āsīno'dṛṣṭo janaḥ kuvindo nihataḥ iti /
analyzed: tena ca antarāle āsīna udṛṣṭaḥ janaḥ kuvindaḥ nihataḥ iti
translated: And in the meantime, a weaver sitting unseen was killed.

original: narapatinoce tad gaccha /
analyzed: narapatinā ūce tat gaccha
translated: The king said, Go,

original: daṇḍin /
analyzed: daṇḍin
translated: O stick-bearer,

original: asyā eva bhartā bhava iti /
analyzed: asyāḥ eva bhartā bhava iti
translated: be the husband of this very woman.

original: tayā tantuvāyajāyayā jagade prathamato me khāmī mṛtaḥ /
analyzed: tayā tantuvāya jāyayā jagade   prathamatas me khāmī mṛtaḥ
translated: She said, First my husband was killed by me.

original: dvitīyato yato'yaṃ vaidheyo dhavo mama bhaviṣyati varamato daṇḍayeva jayī bhavatu nirṇaye iti /
analyzed: dvitīyatas yatas iyam vaidheyaḥ dhavaḥ mama bhaviṣyati varam atas daṇḍaya iva jayī bhavatu nirṇaye iti
translated: Second, since this weaver will be my husband, it is better that the stick-bearer himself be victorious in the decision.

original: tataḥ sūtradhareṇodīritam yato'yaṃ daṇḍī māṃ pṛṣṭavān ' kiyaj jalasya gāmbhīryami ' ti ato mama mukhād vidhṛtaḥ kuṭhāro nīre patitaḥ iti /
analyzed: tatas sūtradhareṇa udīritam   daṇḍī mām pṛṣṭavān kiyat jalasya gāmbhīryam iti  atas mama mukhāt vidhṛtaḥ kuṭhāraḥ nīre patitaḥ
translated: Then the stage manager said, Since this stick-bearer asked me, 'How deep is the water?', therefore the axe was held in my mouth and fell into the water.

original: bhūpena maṇitam yat kiñcidapi hārya vastu skandhe vahanasya
analyzed: bhūpena maṇitam   yat kiñcid api hārya vastu skandhe vahanasya
translated: The king said, Since any object to be stolen is suitable to be carried on the shoulder of the thief,

original: yogyamiti hetor anena yata ānane paraśur ūḍhaḥ ataḥ pūrvam asya sūtradharasya dantadvayaṃ bhaṅgdhi /
analyzed: yogyam iti hetoḥ anena yatas ānane paraśuḥ ūḍhaḥ atas pūrvam asya sūtradharasya danta dvayam bhaṅgdhi
translated: for this reason, since the axe was carried in his mouth, therefore first break the two teeth of this stage manager.

original: ' kim asty ambhaso gāmbhīryami ' ti yataḥ papracche daṇḍī ato'sya jihvāṃ chindhi iti /
analyzed: kim asti ambhasaḥ gāmbhīryam i ti yatas papracche daṇḍī atas asya jihvām chinddhi  / iti
translated: When he asked, Is there any depth in water? from which he asked, then cut off his tongue.

original: tadā sūtradhareṇokm prathamato mama paraśurnaṣṭaḥ evaṃ te sarve svasvocitāṃ pṛthag vicāraniṣpattiṃ cākriṃre /
analyzed: tadā sūtradhareṇa ukm   prathamatas mama paraśuḥ naṣṭaḥ evam te sarve sva sva ucitām pṛthak vicāra niṣpattim cākriṃre
translated: Then the stage manager said, My axe is lost first. Thus they all made their individual decisions according to their own suitability.

original: daṇḍī ca sarvāparādhebhyo mumuce iti //
analyzed: daṇḍī ca sarva aparādhebhyaḥ mumuce iti
translated: And the stick-holder was freed from all offenses.
